sentences: Tema perekonnas on mingisega seotud probleemid.
Eile kohtusin mingise ja tema sõbra.
context: The word 'mingis' refers to a male person, often used when the name is unknown or not specified. It can be translated as 'a man', 'some man', or just 'he'. It's commonly used in conversational Estonian to refer to men without using their actual names.
